20101206192053.500|20101206192056.000|CCO|THE OFFICIAL PROPONENTS WOULD BE
20101206192056.000|20101206192058.500|CCO|AUTHORIZED IN THE DEFAULT OF THE
20101206192058.500|20101206192101.000|CCO|STATE OFFICIALS, IN LIEU OF
20101206192101.000|20101206192102.667|CCO|STATE OFFICIALS WHO HAVE
20101206192102.667|20101206192104.333|CCO|DECLINED TO DEFEND. 
20101206192104.333|20101206192106.000|CCO|WOULD BE AUTHORIZED TO COME IN
20101206192106.000|20101206192107.667|CCO|AND REPRESENT ESSENTIALLY THE
20101206192107.667|20101206192109.333|CCO|STATE'S INTEREST IN DEFENDING A

20101206192246.000|20101206192248.500|CCO|>> GOOD MORNING AGAIN TO YOU, AS
20101206192248.500|20101206192251.000|CCO|WELL, YOUR HONOR. 
20101206192251.000|20101206192252.667|CCO|THE PEOPLE OF CALIFORNIA AND
20101206192252.667|20101206192254.333|CCO|AMERICANS BROUGHT THE COUNTRY
20101206192254.333|20101206192256.000|CCO|ARE ENGAGED IN AN EARNEST AND
20101206192256.000|20101206192257.667|CCO|PROFOUND DEBATE ABOUT THE
20101206192257.667|20101206192259.333|CCO|MEANING, PURPOSES, AND
20101206192259.333|20101206192301.000|CCO|DEFINITION OF MARRIAGE. 
20101206192301.000|20101206192303.000|CCO|THE ISSUE IS A MOMENTOUS ONE,
20101206192303.000|20101206192305.000|CCO|FOR IT GOES TO THE VERY NATURE
20101206192305.000|20101206192307.000|CCO|OF AN ANCIENT AND UBIQUITOUS
20101206192307.000|20101206192309.000|CCO|SOCIAL INSTITUTION THAT IS, IN
20101206192309.000|20101206192311.000|CCO|THE WORDS OF THE UNITED STATES
20101206192311.000|20101206192313.500|CCO|SUPREME COURT, FUNDAMENTAL TO
20101206192313.500|20101206192316.000|CCO|THE VERY EXISTENCE AND SURVIVAL
20101206192316.000|20101206192318.500|CCO|OF THE HUMAN RACE. 
20101206192318.500|20101206192321.000|CCO|THIS COURT IS PRESENTED WITH, IN
20101206192321.000|20101206192323.000|CCO|OUR SUBMISSION, THIS FUNDAMENTAL
20101206192323.000|20101206192325.000|CCO|QUESTION. 
20101206192325.000|20101206192327.000|CCO|IT IS WHETHER THE DEFINITION OF
20101206192327.000|20101206192329.000|CCO|MARRIAGE, THAT MOMENTOUS ISSUE,

20101206192431.000|20101206192436.000|CCO|LIKE THE, FOR EXAMPLE, THE

20101206192755.000|20101206192757.000|CCO|BUT THAT IS THE TEST THAT WE
20101206192757.000|20101206192759.000|CCO|SUBMIT TO YOU THAT APPLIES, YOUR
20101206192759.000|20101206192801.000|CCO|HONOR. 
20101206192801.000|20101206192803.000|CCO|AND WE BELIEVE THAT THERE IS
20101206192803.000|20101206192805.000|CCO|CLEARLY A RATIONAL BASIS AND
20101206192805.000|20101206192807.000|CCO|JUSTIFYING THE TRADITIONAL
20101206192807.000|20101206192809.000|CCO|DEFINITION OF MARRIAGE. 
20101206192809.000|20101206192811.000|CCO|THE KEY REASON THAT MARRIAGE HAD
20101206192811.000|20101206192813.500|CCO|EXISTED AT ALL IN ANY SOCIETY
20101206192813.500|20101206192816.000|CCO|AND AT ANY TIME IS THAT SEXUAL
20101206192816.000|20101206192818.500|CCO|RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN MEN AND
20101206192818.500|20101206192821.000|CCO|WOMEN, NATURALLY PRODUCE
20101206192821.000|20101206192823.000|CCO|CHILDREN. 
20101206192823.000|20101206192825.000|CCO|SOCIETY HAS NO PARTICULAR
20101206192825.000|20101206192827.000|CCO|INTEREST IN A PLATONIC
20101206192827.000|20101206192829.000|CCO|RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN A MAN AND
20101206192829.000|20101206192831.000|CCO|WOMAN, NO MATTER HOW CLOSE, NO
20101206192831.000|20101206192833.000|CCO|MATTER HOW COMMITTED IT MAY BE,
20101206192833.000|20101206192835.000|CCO|OR EMOTIONAL RELATIONSHIP IS
20101206192835.000|20101206192837.000|CCO|BETWEEN OTHER PEOPLE AS WELL. 
20101206192837.000|20101206192839.000|CCO|BUT WHEN A RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
20101206192839.000|20101206192841.000|CCO|A MAN AND A WOMAN BECOMES A
20101206192841.000|20101206192843.000|CCO|SEXUAL ONE, SOCIETY IMMEDIATELY
20101206192843.000|20101206192845.000|CCO|HAS A VITAL INTEREST IN THAT,
20101206192845.000|20101206192847.000|CCO|FOR TWO REASONS. 
20101206192847.000|20101206192849.000|CCO|ONE, SOCIETY NEEDS OF THE
20101206192849.000|20101206192851.000|CCO|CREATION OF NEW LIFE FOR THE
20101206192851.000|20101206192856.000|CCO|NEXT GENERATION, BUT SECONDLY,
20101206192856.000|20101206192901.000|CCO|SOCIETY -- ITS VITAL INTERESTS
20101206192901.000|20101206192903.500|CCO|ARE ACTUALLY THREATENED BY THE
20101206192903.500|20101206192906.000|CCO|POSSIBILITIES THAT
20101206192906.000|20101206192908.500|CCO|UNINTENTIONAL AND UNWANTED
20101206192908.500|20101206192911.000|CCO|PREGNANCY WOULD MEAN THAT THE
20101206192911.000|20101206192913.500|CCO|CHILD IS BORN OUT OF WEDLOCK AND
20101206192913.500|20101206192916.000|CCO|IS RAISED BY, IN ALL
20101206192916.000|20101206192918.500|CCO|LIKELIHOOD, ITS MOTHER ALONE. 
20101206192918.500|20101206192921.000|CCO|AND THAT DIRECTLY IMPLICATES
20101206192921.000|20101206192923.500|CCO|SOCIETY IS VITAL INTERESTS. 
20101206192923.500|20101206192926.000|CCO|BOTH IN TERMS OF ITS IMMEDIATE
20101206192926.000|20101206192928.500|CCO|INTERESTS BECAUSE SOCIETY WOULD
20101206192928.500|20101206192931.000|CCO|HAVE TO EP IN AND DESIST
20101206192931.000|20101206192934.333|CCO|BACKED SINGLE -- A SYSTEM THAT
20101206192934.333|20101206192937.667|CCO|SINGLE-PARENT AND ALL LIKELIHOOD
20101206192937.667|20101206192941.000|CCO|-- THAT IS WHAT USUALLY HAPPENS
20101206192941.000|20101206192943.000|CCO|-- IN THE RAISING OF THAT CHILD,
20101206192943.000|20101206192945.000|CCO|BUT AS WELL, IN THE UNDENIABLE
20101206192945.000|20101206192947.000|CCO|FACT THAT CHILDREN RAISED IN

20101206192951.000|20101206192953.000|CCO|>> THAT SOUNDS LIKE A GOOD

20101206192957.000|20101206192959.000|CCO|[LAUGHTER]
20101206192959.000|20101206193001.000|CCO|BUT HOW DOES IT RELATE TO HAVING

20101206193007.667|20101206193011.000|CCO|THEY CAN, IN CALIFORNIA AND FORM

20101206193017.667|20101206193019.333|CCO|ARGUMENT SAYS WE OUGHT TO
20101206193019.333|20101206193021.000|CCO|PROHIBIT THAT. 
20101206193021.000|20101206193023.500|CCO|>> YOUR HONOR, THE POINT AND THE
20101206193023.500|20101206193026.000|CCO|QUESTION IS WHETHER OR NOT THE
20101206193026.000|20101206193028.500|CCO|STATE OF CALIFORNIA HAS A
20101206193028.500|20101206193031.000|CCO|RATIONAL REASON FOR DRAWING A
20101206193031.000|20101206193036.000|CCO|DISTINCTION BETWEEN SAME-SEX
20101206193036.000|20101206193041.000|CCO|COUPLES WHO CANNOT, WITHOUT THE
20101206193041.000|20101206193043.500|CCO|INTERVENTION OF A THIRD PARTY OF
20101206193043.500|20101206193046.000|CCO|THE OPPOSITE SEX, PROCREATE, AND
20101206193046.000|20101206193048.500|CCO|OPPOSITE SEX COUPLES WHO NOT
20101206193048.500|20101206193051.000|CCO|ONLY CAN APPROPRIATE BUT CAN DO
20101206193051.000|20101206193053.500|CCO|SO UNINTENTIONALLY AND CREATE
20101206193053.500|20101206193056.000|CCO|UNWANTED PREGNANCIES. 
20101206193056.000|20101206193058.500|CCO|THAT IS NOT A PHENOMENON THAT
20101206193058.500|20101206193101.000|CCO|EXISTS WITH RESPECT TO SAME-SEX
20101206193101.000|20101206193106.000|CCO|COUPLES. 
20101206193106.000|20101206193111.000|CCO|>> WHAT IS THE RATIONAL BASIS
20101206193111.000|20101206193113.500|CCO|FOR AN INITIATIVE BACKED WENT --
20101206193113.500|20101206193116.000|CCO|THAT WHEN CALIFORNIA LAW REALLY
20101206193116.000|20101206193118.500|CCO|SAYS THAT HOMOSEXUAL COUPLES
20101206193118.500|20101206193121.000|CCO|HAVE ALL THE RIGHTS OF A
20101206193121.000|20101206193123.500|CCO|MARRIAGE, ALL THE RIGHTS OF
20101206193123.500|20101206193126.000|CCO|CHILD REARING, ALL THE RIGHT TO
20101206193126.000|20101206193128.500|CCO|THAT ALL THE OTHERS HAVE -- WHAT
20101206193128.500|20101206193131.000|CCO|IS THE RATIONAL BASIS THEN IF,
20101206193131.000|20101206193134.333|CCO|IN FACT, THE HOMOSEXUAL COUPLES
20101206193134.333|20101206193137.667|CCO|HAVE ALL OF THE RIGHTS THAT THE
20101206193137.667|20101206193141.000|CCO|HETEROSEXUAL COUPLES HAVE?
20101206193141.000|20101206193143.000|CCO|WE ARE LEFT WITH A WORD,
20101206193143.000|20101206193145.000|CCO|MARRIAGE. 
20101206193145.000|20101206193147.000|CCO|WHAT IS THE RATIONAL BASIS FOR
20101206193147.000|20101206193149.000|CCO|THAT?
20101206193149.000|20101206193151.000|CCO|>> YOUR HONOR, YOU ARE LEFT WITH

20101206193154.333|20101206193157.667|CCO|ESSENTIALLY THE INSTITUTION. 
20101206193157.667|20101206193201.000|CCO|AND IF YOU READ THE FINE IN THE
20101206193201.000|20101206193204.333|CCO|INSTITUTION, IF YOU REDEFINE THE
20101206193204.333|20101206193207.667|CCO|WORD, AND YOU CHANGE THE
20101206193207.667|20101206193211.000|CCO|INSTITUTION.

20101206193216.000|20101206193218.500|CCO|THE NAME OF MARRIAGE IS

20101206194211.000|20101206194213.000|CCO|YOUR HONOR, WE SUBMIT TO YOU
20101206194213.000|20101206194215.000|CCO|THAT THE CASE CAME TO THE PEOPLE

20101206194217.000|20101206194219.000|CCO|CASE CAME TO THE CALIFORNIA
20101206194219.000|20101206194221.000|CCO|SUPREME COURT. 
20101206194221.000|20101206194223.500|CCO|ON REVIEW FROM A DECISION OF THE
20101206194223.500|20101206194226.000|CCO|CALIFORNIA COURT OF APPEALS, THE
20101206194226.000|20101206194228.500|CCO|LOWER TRIBUNAL. 
20101206194228.500|20101206194231.000|CCO|AND THE CALIFORNIA ELECTORATE
20101206194231.000|20101206194234.333|CCO|DISAGREED RESPECTFULLY WITH
20101206194234.333|20101206194237.667|CCO|THEIR SUPREME COURT -- AND THE
20101206194237.667|20101206194241.000|CCO|REVERSE THE. 
20101206194241.000|20101206194244.333|CCO|IN THE CRAWFORD CASE, I WOULD
20101206194244.333|20101206194247.667|CCO|SUBMIT TO YOU, AT THE POINT OF
20101206194247.667|20101206194251.000|CCO|THIS. 
20101206194251.000|20101206194254.333|CCO|ANOTHER CASE WHERE THE
20101206194254.333|20101206194257.667|CCO|CALIFORNIA COURTS HAD
20101206194257.667|20101206194301.000|CCO|INTERPRETED THE CALIFORNIA
20101206194301.000|20101206194302.429|CCO|CONSTITUTION, I BELIEVE IT WAS,
20101206194302.429|20101206194303.857|CCO|THE CALIFORNIA CONSTITUTION THAT
20101206194303.857|20101206194305.286|CCO|THEY INTERPRETED TO GO BEYOND

20101206194308.143|20101206194309.571|CCO|AND THE PEOPLE OF CALIFORNIA

20101206194311.000|20101206194313.000|CCO|BACK TO THE PLACE THAT IS
20101206194313.000|20101206194315.000|CCO|REQUIRED BY THE FEDERAL
20101206194315.000|20101206194317.000|CCO|CONSTITUTION. 
20101206194317.000|20101206194319.000|CCO|AND THE COURT SAID, IN A STATE
20101206194319.000|20101206194321.000|CCO|LIKE CALIFORNIA WHERE THE PEOPLE
20101206194321.000|20101206194323.000|CCO|RETAIN THE ULTIMATE POWER OF
20101206194323.000|20101206194325.000|CCO|THE GOVERNMENT -- 
20101206194325.000|20101206194327.000|CCO|>> GENERALLY YOU CAN AMEND THE
20101206194327.000|20101206194329.000|CCO|CONSTITUTION. 
20101206194329.000|20101206194331.000|CCO|THAT IS TRUE. 
20101206194331.000|20101206194333.000|CCO|IT DEPENDS ON THIS SUBJECT AND
20101206194333.000|20101206194335.000|CCO|WHAT YOU ARE UNENDING.

20101206194341.000|20101206194342.667|CCO|WHAT IS IT YOU ARE UNENDING AND
20101206194342.667|20101206194344.333|CCO|CAN YOU RECOMMEND THAT?

20101206194346.000|20101206194347.667|CCO|AMEND THE CALIFORNIA
20101206194347.667|20101206194349.333|CCO|CONSTITUTION. 
20101206194349.333|20101206194351.000|CCO|NO MATTER HOW THE COURTS HAVE
20101206194351.000|20101206194353.500|CCO|INTERPRETED AS A GENERAL RULE.

20101206194411.000|20101206194416.000|CCO|>> YOUR HONOR, I BELIEVE THAT

20101206194427.000|20101206194429.000|CCO|>> NOT ANYTHING.

20101206194431.000|20101206194433.500|CCO|NOW HAVE SEGREGATED EDUCATION?

20101206194436.000|20101206194438.500|CCO|>> NO, YOUR HONOR, BECAUSE THE
20101206194438.500|20101206194441.000|CCO|FEDERAL CONSTITUTION WOULD HAVE
20101206194441.000|20101206194444.333|CCO|OUTLAWED THAT QUITE APART FROM

20101206195109.000|20101206195111.000|CCO|>> YOUR HONOR, I BELIEVE THAT

20101206195157.667|20101206195201.000|CCO|GROUND?
20101206195201.000|20101206195203.000|CCO|>> THIS PROPOSITION I AM
20101206195203.000|20101206195205.000|CCO|ADVANCING NOW, NO, THE POINT
20101206195205.000|20101206195207.000|CCO|BEING THAT ANY TIME A STATE GOES
20101206195207.000|20101206195209.000|CCO|BEYOND -- AND HERE I AM ASSUMING
20101206195209.000|20101206195211.000|CCO|THAT THIS WOULD GO BEYOND WHAT
20101206195211.000|20101206195213.500|CCO|THE FEDERAL CONSTITUTION DEMANDS
20101206195213.500|20101206195216.000|CCO|-- AND IF IT GOES BEYOND WHAT
20101206195216.000|20101206195218.500|CCO|THE FEDERAL CONSTITUTION
20101206195218.500|20101206195221.000|CCO|DEMANDS, THEN THE PEOPLE ARE
20101206195221.000|20101206195222.667|CCO|FREE, ACCORDING TO THE SPECIFIC
20101206195222.667|20101206195224.333|CCO|LANGUAGE OF CRAWFORD, HAVING
20101206195224.333|20101206195226.000|CCO|GONE BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF
20101206195226.000|20101206195227.667|CCO|THE FEDERAL CONSTITUTION, A
20101206195227.667|20101206195229.333|CCO|STATE IS FREE TO RETURN TO THE
20101206195229.333|20101206195231.000|CCO|STANDARD PREVAILING GENERALLY
20101206195231.000|20101206195234.333|CCO|THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES. 
20101206195234.333|20101206195237.667|CCO|>> IF THE PROPOSITION HAD SIMPLY
20101206195237.667|20101206195241.000|CCO|DONE AWAY WITH THE CIVIL UNIONS,
20101206195241.000|20101206195243.000|CCO|CRAWFORD WOULD SAY THAT IS OK?
20101206195243.000|20101206195245.000|CCO|>> IF IT HAD SIMPLY -- 
20101206195245.000|20101206195247.000|CCO|>> IF PROPOSITION 8 HAD SIMPLY
20101206195247.000|20101206195249.000|CCO|BEEN ADDRESSED TO DISALLOWING
20101206195249.000|20101206195251.000|CCO|CIVIL UNIONS WHICH, AS I
20101206195251.000|20101206195253.500|CCO|UNDERSTAND, AND OUT UNDER
20101206195253.500|20101206195256.000|CCO|CALIFORNIA LAW, IF THAT IS ALL
20101206195256.000|20101206195258.500|CCO|THE PROPOSITION SAID, CRAWFORD
20101206195258.500|20101206195301.000|CCO|WOULD SAY THAT IS OKAY?
20101206195301.000|20101206195302.667|CCO|>> YES, YOUR HONOR, TO THE
20101206195302.667|20101206195304.333|CCO|EXTENT THAT CIVIL UNIONS ARE NOT
20101206195304.333|20101206195306.000|CCO|REQUIRED BY THE FEDERAL
20101206195306.000|20101206195307.667|CCO|CONSTITUTION. 
20101206195307.667|20101206195309.333|CCO|>> WHAT DOES THAT MEAN TO THE
20101206195309.333|20101206195311.000|CCO|EXTENT THAT?
20101206195311.000|20101206195313.500|CCO|THEY COULD TAKE IT AWAY OR THEY
20101206195313.500|20101206195316.000|CCO|COULD NOT?
